IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE WITH A CHRISTIAN WORLDVIEW AND HIGH ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO EDUCATE STUDENTS FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS IN AN ACADEMICALLY DEMANDING CHRIST-CENTERED COMMUNITY, INSPIRING THEM TO LEAD LIVES OF FAITH, INTEGRITY & SERVICE.
IRS990.Desc: BOSTON TRINITY ACADEMY HELD CLASSES DURING THE YEAR SERVING 245 STUDENTS ACROSS GRADES 6-12. THESE COLLEGE-PREPARATORY CLASSES INCLUDING MATH, SCIENCE, HISTORY, ENGLISH, HUMANITIES, ETC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ACADEMY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AS AN ENTITY DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3). THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN MADE. THE ACADEMY HAS BEEN DETERMINED TO BE OTHER THAN A PRIVATE FOUNDATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. TAX YEARS FROM JUNE 30, 2014 THROUGH THE CURRENT YEAR REMAIN OPEN FOR EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE TAX AUTHORITIES.
FINANCIAL AID NETTED WITH TUITION REVENUE 1,652,475 FUNDRAISING EXPENSES INCLUDED WITH REVENUE -29,078 TOTAL TO SCHEDULE D, PART XI, LINE 4B 1,623,397
FINANCIAL AID NETTED WITH TUITION REVENUE 1,652,475 FUNDRAISING EXPENSES INCLUDED WITH REVENUE -29,078 TOTAL TO SCHEDULE D, PART XII, LINE 4B 1,623,397
THE ORGANIZATION PUBLICIZED ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN THE BOSTON GLOBE
THE ORGANIZATION OFFERS FINANCIAL AID/SCHOLARSHIPS THAT REDUCES THE AMOUNTNOF TUITION THAT A FAMILY PAYS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD ESTABLISHED EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT FROM TIME TO TIME ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FAMILY RELATIONSHIP: ROBERT BRADLEY, CHAIRMAN & NANCY BRADLEY, BOARD MEMBER

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT AND AUDITING FIRM REVIEW THE TAX RETURN. CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD REVIEWS AND MAKES COPIES AVAILABLE TO MEMBERS OF THE BOARD AT THE MEETING BEFORE FILING TAKES PLACE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD. IF A FAMILY MEMBER IS BEING CONSIDERED FOR EMPLOYMENT THE BOARD MUST VOTE UNANIMOUSLY ON THE HIRE. BOARD MEMBERS RECUSE THEMSELVES IF THERE IS ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION FOR TOP MANANGEMENT INCLUDES A REVIEW OF COMPARABLE BENCHMARKS WITH PRIVATE/PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE REVIEW AND DISCUSSION IS A PART OF BOARD MINUTES. THE REVIEW IS DONE ANNUALLY AT THE FEBRUARY MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

NO CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE PROCESS OF BOSTON TRINITY HAVING A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT, REVIEW, OR COMPILATION OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.
